Class Buffer

  • Object
    • Buffer

  • public class Buffer
extends Object
    A buffer that can be used to transfer int data
    Author:
    Andrew Huber

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ConcurrentLinkedQueue<Integer> buffer
      The actual buffer
      private int n
      N provided by Driver.java; look in project description doc for more information
      private Runnable runnable
      A runnable that will be called when N2 items have been added
      private boolean runnableCalled
      The runnable will only be called once; this boolean flag makes sure that it is only called once.
      private int size
      The maximum size of this buffer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Buffer(int n, Runnable runnable)
      Creates a new Buffer to store int values

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(int i)
      Add an int to the buffer
      int remove()
      Removes an int from the head of the buffer
      int size()
      Returns the number of items in this buffer
      AtomicIntegerArray toArray()
      Returns an AtomicIntegerArray of all the numbers stored in the buffer at a particular moment
      String toString()

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

        private Runnable runnable
        A runnable that will be called when N2 items have been added

      • runnableCalled

        private boolean runnableCalled
        The runnable will only be called once; this boolean flag makes sure that it is only called once.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Buffer

        public Buffer(int n,
      Runnable runnable)
        Creates a new Buffer to store int values
        Parameters:
        n - provided by Driver.java; look in project description doc for more information
        runnable - A runnable that will be called when N2 items have been added; if you want no task to be performed at that time, pass in null

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(int i)
        Add an int to the buffer
        Parameters:
        i - the int to add
        Returns:
        true if i was successfully added to the buffer because there was room for it, false if i was unsuccessfully added to the buffer because there was no room.

      • remove

        public int remove()
        Removes an int from the head of the buffer
        Returns:
        The int from the head of the buffer or -1 if there is nothing to remove

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of items in this buffer
        Returns:
        the number of items in this buffer

      • toArray

        public AtomicIntegerArray toArray()
        Returns an AtomicIntegerArray of all the numbers stored in the buffer at a particular moment
        Returns:
        an AtomicIntegerArray of all the numbers stored in the buffer at a particular moment

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
